byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Norman, Okla., and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Susan Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: University of Oklahoma expels two students who it says led racist chant by members of Sigma Alpha Epsilon; national fraternity vows to look into claims that chant originated elsewhere and is used at other colleges in other states.
lead_paragraph: Officials said the two students with Sigma Alpha Epsilon had been identified as having played a leading role in singing a racist chant on a bus.

headline.main: As Two Oklahoma Students Are Expelled for Racist Chant, Sigma Alpha Epsilon Vows Wider Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Fraternity Vows Broader Look Into Use of Racist Chant

snippet: Officials said the two students with Sigma Alpha Epsilon had been identified as having played a leading role in singing a racist chant on a bus.
